snippet: If immigrant children turn 21 before their parents get green cards, they “age out” of the immigration system, a policy that the Supreme Court is reviewing.
abstract: Federal law allows immigrants to name children under 21 as dependents on green card applications, but unless the parents receive their documentation before those children turn 21, their offspring 'age out' of the immigration system and face a painful choice as they approach adulthood; they can remain in the United States illegally, or return to countries they left years ago; fate of many such young immigrants across the country may hinge on an immigration case the Supreme Court is expected to decide shortly.
lead_paragraph: If immigrant children turn 21 before their parents get green cards, they “age out” of the immigration system, a policy that the Supreme Court is reviewing.

headline.main: Court May Hold Fate of Children Knocked Off Citizenship Path
headline.print_headline: Court May Hold Fate of Children Knocked Off Citizenship Path
